Beautifully chunky/slicey melee combat with a touch of personal defense as the Founding Fathers intended(most of the time).

Very few FPS games can pull off melee as well as VT2 does. You got a bladed weapon? Alright, have fun mowing through hordes of ratmen and rotbloods, but watch your ass the moment anything with a bit of armor comes around. You got a hammer? Deal with the armored guys for your sharper buddies while they cover your ass against a wave of lighter, less metallic enemies. Simple as.

Gunplay's relatively consistent despite the limits of the time period in WH lore. Anything single-shot feels really satisfying to land a OHK with, and anything with more than one shot before reloading is fun to spam despite the smaller ammunition pool that all ranged weapons have. 

Very few games with build systems or skill trees have matched heads with something like Borderlands 2 for me, but VT2 gets pretty damn close. I was a little angry at first due to all heroes having one to two identical aspects in their skill-tree, but the temporary health on melee damage/kill/stagger abilities will literally carry the hell out of you. Other than that, very little in the heroes' respective skill-trees seems to make them too overpowered or too underwhelming. 

Moral of the story is, for a horde shooter, this game has a surprisingly high skill ceiling, and is 100% worth grabbing anytime a discount rolls around. DLC could be better, but overall there's plenty in the base game to keep you satisfied for a while.

A pretty good melee-focused horde game in a similar style to Left 4 Dead, but with rats and the forces of chaos. Great fun with friends, but playing solo with bots is still very enjoyable, and is how I mainly play. Each of the 5 characters has 3 different careers (most have a 4th career as dlc) which suit different play styles, and have distinct personalities. Missions have decent repeatability, with random special enemies, hordes and bosses from start to finish, as well as tomes and grimoires to collect. One issue with Vermintide 2 is that it forces you to play the lowest difficulty to begin with, which can be quite easy, but later difficulties can give a decent challenge once you unlock them. I'd say give it a shot, especially if you can grab the game on sale or get a group of friends to play it with you. Also the voice acting is brilliant, listening to Saltzpyre shouting about heresy or Sienna being a crazy pyromaniac is great fun, and depending on which characters there are in your team, you get to hear some amusing conversations.

Stunning game really, one of the most punchy and meaty melee combat, far surpassing dare I say Left for Dead 2?

The game isn't too long for what you pay for honestly, and the DLCs aren't the most worthwhile things to get without a sale, but for anything else inside the game itself? Amazing environments, detailed enemies, great sound design and music are just some of the things that allow you to be submerged in the Warhammer Fantasy universe that this game is set in.

All in all the game might not hold the most amount of content compared to other games out on the market, but the amount of effort and dedication that the team working on this game poured into the individual missions' environment and characters are definitely noticable.

Now if they would just get to working on a proper dlc...

This game was more fun when it was called "Left For Dead".
If you prefer dull and repetitive game play where you can literally just button mash one button and win, then this game may be for you. The upgrades are so useless, that you don't even need them and can skip them and still do just fine.
The only difficult part of this game is that certain enemies can stop you from doing anything and slowly kill you if your team mates do do anything about it when this happens. You can't fight them off or anything if you are the one attacked.
So it's incredibly easy or completely hopeless in the perfect circumstances, but to be honest, it's not that hard to not get attacked by these specific enemies.

The controls and movement feel very clunky and limited.
The graphics are meh. Honestly, if you haven't played "Left for Dead", just go play that instead as it's the better version.
